page.title: 16Down Court -near Slad.(1)
page.content:
The house we visited used to be five separate cottages for labourers on Down Farm.They were built about four hundred years ago.An old well in front of the house was in use until 20 years ago(the water is now pumped to a small reservoir and filtered). One room was a shepherd's house.He also cured hams and there are still marks on one wall where the hams used to hang. {Claire Hearfield.
The Dillay Valley farms once supported 200 but people have moved out as farms have become more mechanised.Many old houses have collapsed but some have become holiday cottages.Now only two households remain.One 'declined farm' has been bought by the Glos.Trust for Nature Conservation because it has never been artificially fertilised.
